q: Eagles' Michael Vick , Ben Roethlisberger might be the toughest quarterback to sack, said Jets defensive end Shaun Ellis. "He's very strong. He's very elusive in the pocket," Ellis said. A lot of people don't realize how fast he is.... I know he looks slow moving around on the field, but he's pretty nifty at what he does. What Ben Roethlisberger has done best so far in his career is win. He went to the AFC title game as a rookie, won a Super Bowl in his second season, and added another championship in

announced Thursday that he is handing his job over to co-founder Larry Page, who, Eric Schmidt blogs, "is ready to lead." Eric Schmidt will stick around with the hefty title of executive chairman. Official Google Blog: For the last 10 years, we[ CEO Eric Schmidt and co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin ] have all been equally involved in making decisions. This triumvirate approach has real benefits in terms of shared wisdom, and we will continue to discuss the big decisions among the three of us. But we have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Posts by unregistered readers are moderated. executive chairman, "a lot of my time" will be devoted to dealing with regulators and other government officials, Eric Schmidt said. "We've got very complicated government issues," he said, adding that we move quickly, and we tend to be disruptive at scale. European Union officials opened a formal antitrust probe last year into Google search results, while in China the company opted to shut down its mainland search engine rather than censor results for user queries.
